pr_title: #3453 amendments to allow the Subject Area FVT to run with the Graph Repo

timeline.message:
#3453 Include classification type on classifications supplied with term create

Signed-off-by: David Radley <david_radley@uk.ibm.com>

comment out TermFVT test

Signed-off-by: David Radley <david_radley@uk.ibm.com>

remove unwanted changes

Signed-off-by: David Radley <david_radley@uk.ibm.com>

prevent concurrent modification exception in graph repo during declassify entity

Signed-off-by: David Radley <david_radley@uk.ibm.com>

Self protect in the FVT if there is existing content

Signed-off-by: David Radley <david_radley@uk.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: Could you use the RepositoryHelper's getSkeletonClassification method here instea? It looks like it could save quite a bit of this construction code.
timeline.author: grahamwallis

replies.bodyText: @grahamwallis raised issue #3477 to track this suggested refactor.
replies.author: davidradl

timeline.bodyText:
I don't see why this helps. I may be missing something but I can't see what's wrong with removing the unwanted classification as soon as it is identified, i.e. within the loop.
If there's a good reason for this change, does it not also apply to the classifier edges that need to be removed?
I'm not sure what behaviour occurred that prompted this change. Is it possible that there's a problem with the order of the remove operations?
timeline.author: grahamwallis

replies.bodyText: @grahamwallis This change fixed a concurrent modification exception, I believe the issue was that we called an iterator .next , then a  .remove then .next on the same map (existingClassificationVerticesByName) or its iterator. The second .next got the exception, presumably because it realises that the collection it is iterating over has changed underneath it. The fix solves the problem as the .remove is not done in the iterator loop. I don't think it applies to the classifier vertices as they are not being iterated over. Have I misunderstood something ?
replies.author: davidradl

replies.bodyText: the explanation makes sense to me from the code.
replies.author: planetf1

replies.bodyText: Yes - that makes good sense. I hadn't looked closely enough :-) I was wondering whether it was an issue with the removal of the vertices and then the edges (which should be fine). Thanks for the explanation and for fixing!
replies.author: grahamwallis

timeline.bodyText: Minor: string still contains a superfluous space.
timeline.author: grahamwallis

replies.bodyText:
Minor: string still contains a superfluous space.

I suggest that I fix if I need to make another code change on this pr.
replies.author: davidradl
